data.name: MigrateTitle
data.value: Code First Migrations Command Line Utility

data.name: MigrateDescription
data.value: Applies any pending migrations to the database.

data.name: ErrorMessage
data.value: ERROR: {0}

data.name: WarningMessage
data.value: WARNING: {0}

data.name: VerboseMessage
data.value: VERBOSE: {0}

data.name: DuplicateCommand
data.value: Duplicate Command "{0}"

data.name: DuplicateParameterIndex
data.value: Duplicate Parameter Index [{0}] on Property "{1}"

data.name: ParameterOutOfOrder
data.value: Out of order parameter "{0}" should have be at parameter index {1} but was found at {2}

data.name: InvalidKey
data.value: "{0}" is not a valid choice, valid keys are "{1}"

data.name: PressAnyKey
data.value: Press any key to continue...

data.name: UnsupportedPropertyType
data.value: Unsupported property type {0}

data.name: InvalidPropertyParameterIndexValue
data.value: Invalid ParameterIndex value on property "{0}"

data.name: AssemblyNameArgument
data.value: assembly

data.name: ContextAssemblyNameArgument
data.value: contextAssembly

data.name: ConfigurationTypeNameArgument
data.value: configurationType

data.name: AssemblyNameDescription
data.value: Specifies the name of the assembly that contains the migrations configuration type.

data.name: ContextAssemblyNameDescription
data.value: Specifies the name of the assembly that contains the DbContext type if different from the assembly that contains the migrations configuration type.

data.name: ConfigurationTypeNameDescription
data.value: Specifies the name of the migrations configuration type. If omitted, Code First Migrations will attempt to locate a single migrations configuration type in the specified assembly.

data.name: TargetMigrationDescription
data.value: Specifies the name of a particular migration to update the database to. If omitted, the current model will be used.

data.name: WorkingDirectoryDescription
data.value: Specifies the working directory of your application.

data.name: ConfigurationFileDescription
data.value: Specifies the Web.config or App.config file of your application.

data.name: DataDirectoryDescription
data.value: Specifies the directory to use when resolving connection strings containing the |DataDirectory| substitution string.

data.name: ConnectionStringNameDescription
data.value: Specifies the name of the connection string to use from the specified configuration file. If omitted, the context's default connection will be used.

data.name: ConnectionStringDescription
data.value: Specifies the connection string to use. If omitted, the context's default connection will be used.

data.name: ConnectionProviderNameDescription
data.value: Specifies the provider invariant name of the connection string.

data.name: ForceDescription
data.value: Indicates that automatic migrations which might incur data loss should be allowed.

data.name: VerboseDescription
data.value: Indicates that the executing SQL and additional diagnostic information should be output to the console window.

data.name: HelpDescription
data.value: Display this help message.

data.name: AmbiguousAttributeValues
data.value: Only one of '{0}' and '{1}' can be assigned to.

data.name: AmbiguousConnectionString
data.value: Only one of /connectionStringName or /connectionString can be specified.

data.name: MissingConnectionInfo
data.value: /connectionString and /connectionProviderName must be specified together.

data.name: InvalidParameterIndexValue
data.value: Invalid ParameterIndex value

data.name: InvalidCommandLineArgument
data.value: Invalid argument "{0}" at parameter index {1} in command line "{2}"

data.name: InvalidCommandLineCommand
data.value: Invalid command "{0}" at index {1} in command line "{2}"

data.name: MissingCommandLineParameter
data.value: Missing required parameter {0} "{1}" in command line "{2}"

data.name: ScriptFileDescription
data.value: Specifies the output file where to write the SQL script being generated. Specifying this option will not apply changes to the database.

data.name: SourceMigrationDescription
data.value: Specifies the name of a particular migration to update the database from. If omitted, the current model will be used.
